remarks: "Dimatis", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic.  Some ` ph ` is ` ps ` , and all ` ps ` is ` ch ` , therefore some ` ch ` is ` ph ` . (In Aristotelian notation, IAI-4:  PiM and MaS therefore SiP.) For example, "Some pets are rabbits.", "All rabbits have fur", therefore "Some fur bearing animals are pets".  Like ~ darii with positions interchanged.  (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.)
statement:
dimatis.maj $e |- E. x ( ph /\ ps ) $.
dimatis.min $e |- A. x ( ps -> ch ) $.
dimatis $p |- E. x ( ch /\ ph ) $.
